prompt.p: Viral infection can lead to a chronic antigenic stimulation and dysregulation of cytokines, resulting in B or T cell proliferation. Several viruses are implicated and their geographical locations may influence the development of lymphomas.
What virus is not implicated in lymphomas?

modalFeedback.p:
Option C (Herpes simplex) is Correct. Herpes simplex virus is not implicated in lymphomas.
Option A (Epstein–Barr virus) is Incorrect. Epstein–Barr virus is implicated in lymphomas.
Option B (Hepatitis C virus) is Incorrect. Hepatitis C virus is implicated in lymphomas.
Option D (Human T-cell leukaemia virus type 1) is Incorrect. Human T-cell leukaemia virus type 1 is implicated in lymphomas.
Option E (Kaposi's sarcoma-associated herpes virus) is Incorrect. Kaposi's sarcoma-associated herpes virus is implicated in lymphomas.
